definitions.definition: Awkwardly tall and thin, ungraceful.
definitions.example: A gangling teenager.

definitions.definition: A member of a gang.
To explode or be destroyed by explosion.
definitions.example: Why do cars in movies always blow up when they fall off a cliff?

definitions.definition: To cause (something or someone) to explode, or to destroy (something) or maim or kill (someone) by means of an explosion.
definitions.example: More civilians than soldiers have been blown up by anti-personnel mines.

definitions.definition: To inflate or fill with air, either by literally blowing or using an air pump.
definitions.example: For the school science project, each student will blow up a balloon and then tie it closed.

definitions.definition: To enlarge or zoom in.
definitions.example: Blow up the picture to get a better look at their faces.

definitions.definition: To fail disastrously.
To become popular very quickly.
definitions.example: This album is about to blow up; they’re being promoted on MTV.

definitions.definition: To suddenly get very angry.
definitions.example: Dad blew up at me when I told him I was pregnant.

definitions.definition: To become much more fat or rotund in a short space of time.
To inflate, as with pride, self-conceit, etc.; to puff up.
definitions.example: to blow someone up with flattery

definitions.definition: To excite.
definitions.example: to blow up a contention

definitions.definition: To scold violently.
definitions.example: to blow up a person for some offence

definitions.definition: To blow the whistle.
To succumb to the oxygen debt and lose the ability to maintain pace in a race.
To bombard with a large number of telephone calls, texts, etc.
To cause a malodorous smell by flatulation or defecation
definitions.example: Don't go in there...I really blew it up.

definitions.definition: A living room; a room in the front of the house which is used for entertaining guests or for special occasions.
(grammar) A linguistic category of words sharing syntactic or morphological behaviour and semantic properties, such as noun or verb.
Something which is limp or sagging
A condition or posture of drooping
definitions.example: He walked with a discouraged droop.

definitions.definition: To hang downward; to sag.
To slowly become limp; to bend gradually.
To lose all energy, enthusiasm or happiness; to flag.
To allow to droop or sink.
To proceed downward, or toward a close; to decline.
The office of the pope.
definitions.example: The papacy represents the head of the Catholic Church.

definitions.definition: The period of a particular pope's reign.
definitions.example: The papacy of John Paul II ended in 2005, after the pope's long battle with illness ended.

definitions.definition: Roman Catholicism generally.
One who travels together with another.
One who sympathizes with the aims or beliefs of an organization, without belonging to it; most often applied to a Communist sympathizer.
To introduce a new rule, law, or system of organisation.
To introduce a person or group of people to an organisation.
To earn money for a company or for the family.
To return a verdict in a court of law.
To move something indoors.
definitions.example: Could you bring in the groceries?

definitions.definition: To bring (something) into contact with the air, so as to freshen or dry it.
To let fresh air into a room or a building, to ventilate.
To discuss varying viewpoints on a given topic.
To broadcast (a television show etc.).
To be broadcast.
definitions.example: This game show first aired in the 1990s and is still going today.

definitions.definition: To ignore.
An exposure to warm or fresh air.
The broadcast of a television or radio show.
A public expression of an opinion or discussion of a subject.
An outhouse or other structure (especially one with a sloping roof) attached to the outside wall of a building, sometimes as protection from the weather.

An apartment or suite found on an upper floor, or floors, of a tall building, especially one that is expensive or luxurious with panoramic views. Sometimes these are located just under "penthouse mechanical" floors.
Any of the sloping roofs at the side of a real tennis court.
To provide with a penthouse, shelter by means of a shed sloping from a wall, or anything similar.
A spark.
Touchwood; tinder.
A piece of tinder, sometimes impregnated with sulphur; a match.
Courage; spirit; mettle; determination.
An attractive person (normally male).
Semen.
To catch fire; flame up.
To ejaculate.
definitions.example: He spunked into the condom.

definitions.definition: The conservation of a resource.
An organization dedicated to the conservation of natural resources.
A commission that deals with fishery and navigation.
A state in which a company is allowed to continue trading without incurring any new financial liabilities or disposing of any assets.
Ultraviolet colour.
Of electromagnetic radiation beyond (higher in frequency than) light visible to the human eye; radiation with wavelengths from 380 nanometre - 10 nanometre
The ability to bounce back or recover from bad circumstances.
A man who serves as one of a number of attendants to a bridegroom at a wedding, one of whom is the best man.
Lacking fulfillment; marked by a feeling of failure to achieve goals or desires.
Not yet provided as promised, particularly with respect to a contract or an order for a supply of something.
A means of escape.
The effecting of an escape.
A vacation or holiday, or the destination for one.
Pertaining to an escape, as in a vehicle or plans.
definitions.example: They'd been discussing their getaway plans for weeks.

definitions.definition: The act of engaging in transactions designed to obscure the origin of money, especially money that has been obtained illegally.
Belly fat that develops in middle age.
The result of being impaired
A deterioration or weakening
A disability or handicap
definitions.example: visual impairment

definitions.definition: An inefficient part or factor.
A downward revaluation, a write-down.
To design, fashion, make, or arrange in a certain way or form (style)
To call or give a name or title to.
To create for, or give to, someone a style, fashion, or image, particularly one which is regarded as attractive, tasteful, or trendy.
To act in a way which seeks to show that one possesses style.
Any form of decoration or stylistic approach.
A person who is egocentric.
Selfish, self-centered
Egotistical.

Relating to spatial representations: linked to a reference frame based on one's own location within the environment (as when giving the direction as "right" rather than "north"); opposed to allocentric.
A small passerine bird, Fringilla coelebs, of the finch family.
Arguing that a particular case is an exception to a generally accepted rule, without justification or without a relevant basis.
To ride a bicycle or other cycle.
To go through a cycle or to put through a cycle.
To turn power off and back on
definitions.example: Avoid cycling the device unnecessarily.

definitions.definition: To maintain a team's possession of the puck in the offensive zone by handling and passing the puck in a loop from the boards near the goal up the side boards and passing to back to the boards near the goal
definitions.example: They have their cycling game going tonight.

definitions.definition: The sport of riding and racing cycles, especially bicycles.
definitions.example: In all my years as a cycling fan, I've never seen a breakaway like this.

definitions.definition: Any cyclic action or process
That undergoes a cyclic motion or process
A high point of land extending into a body of water, headland; cliff.
A projecting part of the body.
A fastening consisting of two metal rings, designed to go around a person's wrists, and connected by a chain or hinge.
One ring of a locking fetter for the hand or one pair.
To apply handcuffs to
To restrain or restrict.
definitions.example: Dang, I’m handcuffed by these regulations. I’d like to help but it’d be illegal.

definitions.definition: To become bigger, especially due to being engorged.
To cause to become bigger.
definitions.example: Rains and dissolving snow swell the rivers in spring.

definitions.definition: To grow gradually in force or loudness.
definitions.example: The organ music swelled.

definitions.definition: To raise to arrogance; to puff up; to inflate.
definitions.example: to be swelled with pride or haughtiness

definitions.definition: To be raised to arrogance.
To be elated; to rise arrogantly.
To be turgid, bombastic, or extravagant.
definitions.example: swelling words  a swelling style

definitions.definition: To protuberate; to bulge out.
definitions.example: A cask swells in the middle.

definitions.definition: The act of swelling; increase in size.
A bulge or protuberance.
Increase of power in style, or of rhetorical force.
A long series of ocean waves, generally produced by wind, and lasting after the wind has ceased.
A gradual crescendo followed by diminuendo.
A device for controlling the volume of a pipe organ.
A division in a pipe organ, usually the largest enclosed division.
A hillock or similar raised area of terrain.
An upward protrusion of strata from whose central region the beds dip quaquaversally at a low angle.
A person who dresses in a fancy or elegant manner.
A person of high social standing; an important person.
The front brow of a saddle bow, connected in the tree by the two saddle bars to the cantle on the other end.
Fashionable, like a swell or dandy.
Excellent.
Very well.
A Caucasian person, especially a woman
As white as snow; exceptionally white.

To cut into a surface with an acid or other corrosive substance in order to make a pattern. Best known as a technique for creating printing plates, but also used for decoration on metal, and, in modern industry, to make circuit boards.
To engrave a surface.
To make a lasting impression.
definitions.example: The memory of 9/11 is etched into my mind.

definitions.definition: To sketch; to delineate.
The art of producing an image from a metal plate into which an image or text has been etched with acid.
The image created by this process.
Irritating; causing stress.
Any artwork, typically sculpture, in which the object moves.
A competition where riders and horses display a range of skills and aptitudes.
A place of public resort for athletic games, etc.
A meeting for such sports.
The internal skeleton of an animal, which in vertebrates is composed of bone and cartilage.
An unmarried person.
Having no husband or wife.
A skirmish; an encounter.
A fight with stones between two parties of boys.
A wrangle; also, a noise, as in angry contention.
The process by which selective eating clubs at Princeton University choose new members.
To quarrel in a tiresome, insulting manner.
definitions.example: They bickered about dinner every evening.

definitions.definition: To brawl or move tremulously, quiver, shimmer (of a water stream, light, flame, etc.)
(of rain) To patter.
To skirmish; to exchange blows; to fight.
A wooden drinking-cup or other dish.
A developmental phase brought about by the action of hormones as part of the maturing process. For humans, there are three in total.
The age at which a person is first capable of sexual reproduction.
The period when a plant begins to flower.
A small mammal, of the family Erinaceidae or subfamily Erinaceinae (spiny hedgehog, the latter characterized by their spiny back and often by the habit of rolling up into a ball when attacked.)
Any of several spiny mammals, such as the porcupine, that are similar to the hedgehog.
A type of moveable military barricade made from crossed logs or steel bars, laced with barbed wire, used to damage or impede tanks and vehicles; Czech hedgehog.

A spigot mortar-type of depth charge weapon from World War II that simultaneously fires a number of explosives into the water to create a pattern of underwater explosions intended to attack submerged submarines.
A type of chocolate cake (or slice), somewhat similar to an American brownie.
A form of dredging machine.
Certain flowering plants with parts resembling a member of family Erinaceidae
The edible fungus Hydnum repandum.
A kind of electrical transformer with open magnetic circuit, the ends of the iron wire core being turned outward and presenting a bristling appearance.
A way of serving food at a party, consisting of a half melon or potato etc. with individual cocktail sticks of cheese and pineapple stuck into it.
To make use of a hedgehog barricade as a defensive maneuver.
To array with spiky projections like the quills of a hedgehog.
To curl up into a defensive ball.
The degree of which something is in high supply and demand, making it easily convertible to cash
definitions.example: My Picasso painting is not very liquid, it would take me months to sell it. Gold on the other hand is convertible to cash at any moment, making it a very liquid commodity.

definitions.definition: The state or property of being liquid.
An asset's property of being able to be sold without affecting its value; the degree to which it can be easily converted into cash.
definitions.example: Some stocks are traded so rarely that they lack liquidity.

definitions.definition: Availability of cash over short term: ability to service short-term debt.
A semiconductor device that converts the radiant energy of sunlight into electrical energy
(of a baby) after being born, of or pertaining to the period immediately after birth
(of a mother) after giving birth
The flexible structure connecting a foetus with the placenta; it transports nourishment to the foetus and removes waste.
The line that supplies an astronaut with oxygen and communications when outside a spacecraft.
Any of the various lines connecting a rocket to its launch pad before liftoff.
An overdependence on, or overattachment to, one's parents or guardians.
A person who makes monetary loans at interest, taking personal property as security – which may be sold if not redeemed.
Of, or in the manner of a brute
Bestial; lacking human sensibility
Uncontrollable aggressive behaviour by the driver of a road vehicle, especially when caused by stress or frustration.
To injure the brain of, usually temporarily, by violent impact.
definitions.example: The blow will concuss him.

definitions.definition: To force to do something, or give up something, by intimidation; to coerce.
A thing that is renewable; especially, a renewable source of energy.
A renewable resource.
Able to be renewed; capable of renewal.
(of a resource) Sustainable; able to be regrown or renewed; having an ongoing or continuous source of supply; not finite.
definitions.example: Solar and wind power are renewable, but coal is not.

definitions.definition: One in a race who is catching up to others and shows promise of winning.
One who is catching up in some contest and has a likelihood of victory.
One who arrives.
definitions.example: The champ will face all comers.

definitions.definition: Coloration of human, plant or animal tissue, especially by pigment.
(of a person) Not decisive; not marked by promptness or decision.
definitions.example: They were all being very indecisive about what to wear to the party.

definitions.definition: (of a contest etc.) inconclusive or uncertain
definitions.example: The outcome of the race was so indecisive.

definitions.definition: The government official in charge of the Treasury.
The head of a corporation's treasury department.
The official entrusted with the funds and revenues of an organization such as a club.
Contention; gainstriving
Dispute; disputation; quarreling
A dispute; a contentious argument; a brawl
To bicker, or quarrel angrily and noisily.
To herd (horses or other livestock); to supervise, manage (people).
To involve in a quarrel or dispute; to embroil.
The state or quality or characteristic of being red.
definitions.example: Nancy Reagan is famous for the redness of her wardrobe.

definitions.definition: A red discoloration.
definitions.example: Redness and swelling are associated with certain superficial infections.

definitions.definition: A small two-winged fly or midge of the family Ceratopogonidae, which bites and then sucks the blood of mammals; the biting midge; sandfly.
A fish, Lepomis gibbosus.
Of or pertaining to punk (touchwood) - soft or rotted.
Of or pertaining to the punk subculture.

The crime of intentionally exposing the genitals, inner buttocks or female nipples in public (in geographic locations where this is not the cultural norm); or intentionally or knowingly urinating or defecating in public.
A close-fitting, sheer or non-sheer skin-tight garment worn principally by women and girls that covers the body completely from the waist down, usually including the feet.
A similar, non-sheer garment worn by dancers of either sex, especially by ballet dancers.
A garment, similar to briefs, worn chiefly by professional wrestlers.
In blasting rock, a piece of unbroken rock within the pay limit of a blast.
An instrument used to examine a bodily orifice or canal, or a hollow organ.
A small sausage, usually a short hot dog, wrapped in dough and baked.
A (generally pork) sausage wrapped in bacon, most common at Christmas.
Stubbornly adhering to an opinion, purpose, or course, usually with implied unreasonableness; persistent.
Said of inanimate things not easily subdued or removed.
Irrefutable, or impossible to deny
definitions.example: Some believe that there is undeniable evidence of UFOs.

definitions.definition: (often childish) Stomach or belly.
Protruding belly, paunch.
A device (transducer) used to convert sound waves into a varying electric current; normally fed into an amplifier and either recorded or broadcast.
To put one or more microphones on or in.
The steroid hormone hydrocortisone.
A soft, non-matured, Indian cheese.
definitions.example: The spinach was mixed with paneer to make a satisfying meal.

definitions.definition: Any tooth of the first set of teeth of young people (or livestock).
Believing in a single god, deity, spirit, etc., especially for an organized religion, faith, or creed.
A disease in sheep and cattle, caused by a tapeworm and marked by great nervousness or by dullness and stupor.
Of firm build; stiff; stout; strong.
definitions.example: a sturdy oak tree

definitions.definition: Solid in structure or person.
definitions.example: It was a sturdy building, able to withstand strong winds and cold weather.

definitions.definition: Foolishly obstinate or resolute; stubborn.
Resolute, in a good sense; or firm, unyielding quality.
definitions.example: a man of sturdy piety or patriotism

definitions.definition: A chronic disease caused by compulsive and uncontrollable consumption of alcoholic beverages, leading to addiction and deterioration in health and social functioning.
Acute alcohol poisoning.
Prayer beads, a string of beads used to keep track of repetitions in prayer, particularly in the Roman Catholic Marian prayer "Hail Mary" (Ave Maria)

A Roman Catholic devotion involving the repetition of a series of Marian prayers, usually 5, 15, or 20 decades of "Hail Marys", each decade beginning with "Our Father" and ending with "Glory Be to the Father", but sometimes including other Roman Catholic, Anglican, or Lutheran prayers.
(by extension) A series or collection of thoughts, literary pieces, etc. intended for similar contemplation.
A 13th-century coin minted in Europe as a counterfeit debased form of the sterling silver penny of Edward I, at first accepted as a halfpenny and then outlawed.
A rose garden.
Of or relating to argumentation; specifically, presenting a logical argument or line of reasoning; argumentive, discursive.
Prone to argue or dispute.
A court where cases of military law are heard.
To bring court martial proceedings against someone.
A physician who specializes in pediatrics; a children’s doctor or babies’ doctor.

A subgenre of crime fiction which portrays the activities of a police force as they investigate crimes. Unlike in other types of crime fiction, the perpetrator may be known at the outset of the story.
(often in the plural) A very small piece of plush material.
definitions.example: You've got a fuzzy on your coat.

definitions.definition: Something covered with fuzz or hair, as an animal or plush toy.
A person, especially a college student, interested in humanities or social sciences, as opposed to one interested in mathematics, science, or engineering.
A soldier with the rank of private.
Covered with fuzz or a large number of tiny loose fibres like a carpet or many stuffed animals
Vague or imprecise.
definitions.example: My recollection of that event is fuzzy.

definitions.definition: Not clear; unfocused.
definitions.example: I finally threw out a large stack of fuzzy photos.

definitions.definition: The state of being adjourned, or action of adjourning.
definitions.example: At midnight we made a motion for adjournment and everyone went home tired.

definitions.definition: Ampliatio.
A poetic form with regular meter, particularly iambic pentameter, but no fixed rhyme scheme.
definitions.example: Milton's command of blank verse exceeds even Shakespeare's.

definitions.definition: Not realized; possible to obtain or achieve, yet not obtained or achieved.
definitions.example: The architect's unrealized dream was to design the tallest building in the world.
